result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick W Plummer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick W Plummer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick W Plummer was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Patrick W Plummer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each count concur and concur to 14cm2493, 14cm2708.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LW or members of her immediate family, DB. Ban 900 block W Badger Rd.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

timeConds.notes: Imposed & stayed. W/huber. Credit does not apply.

Defn requests no drinking condition be removed.  Parties give arguments.  Ct amends bond to remove shall not comsume alcohol.  All other conditions remain.

- $750.00 cash bail previously posted.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lenora W. or David B.
- Defendant shall not be in the 900 block of W Badger Rd in Madison, WI.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $750.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
